title: Collina Serragrilli 2015 Serragrilli  (Barbaresco)
description: This offers aromas of dark-skinned fruit, eucalyptus and espresso. The concentrated palate delivers raspberry jam, Marasca cherry, roasted coffee bean and licorice alongside youthfully assertive tannins. Drink 2022–2026.

title: Colomé 2014 Estate Malbec (Salta)
description: Inky, concentrated aromas of black fruits are mildly spicy and granular. High acidity along with a grape-skins texture defines the palate, which tastes of grapy blackberry. A compact, narrow finish is flush but lacks expansiveness.

title: Conde Bel 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Subtle cedar and tobacco aromas are smooth and mature. This Gran Reserva from a notoriously tough and cold vintage feels tight, firm and rubbery. Savory, slightly stewed berry and plum flavors are lightly herbal and finish with gritty tension.

title: Deutz NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This beautifully balanced, perfumed wine offers both red fruits and tangy acidity. The dosage fits its fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Dion 2015 Wedding Tree Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Made in the méthode traditionelle, this is lightly toasty and quite dry. The pale tawny gold hue and dried apple flavors suggest that it be consumed in the near term, between now and 2020. There's a touch of pepper adding a bit of welcome spice to the finish.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2015 McMinnville Cuvée Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Wines from this small AVA are often marked with a strong minerality, but here it's only mildly evident. The grapy fruit flavors suggest it was sourced from young vines, and the ample acidity puts that fruit front and center, with little indication of time in new barrels. Enjoy it for its youth and freshness, and drink now–2022.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2016 Dundee Hills Cuvée Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Part of the winery's AVA Collection, this new release is the first of the 2016s. An unusual streak of pine sap enlivens the aromas, not harsh, but definitely present on the palate. There's blueberry and fig fruit as well, and the fig comes with a Newtonian crunch. Though not typical of this AVA in the heart of the Willamette Valley, it's an interesting and compelling wine nonetheless.

title: Domaine Laporte 2015 Les Grandmontains  (Sancerre)
description: A light Pinot Noir, this is soft, full of red-cherry flavors and silky tannins. The wine has a fresh feel while also offering plenty of ripe fruitiness, acidity and a refreshing, crisp aftertaste. Drink this gently structured, balanced wine from 2020.

title: Donnafugata 2015 Chiarandà  (Contessa Entellina)
description: Aromas of ripe orchard fruit, oak, toast and coconut lead the nose. On the enveloping palate, you'll find dried apricot, toasted oak, nut and a hint of crushed herb. Enjoy over the next few years to capture the remaining fruit richness.

title: Duck Pond 2016 Willow Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This limited cuvée includes about one-quarter whole clusters, and saw 30% new French oak. Strawberry, raspberry and a light wash of mocha orchestrate a young, fresh and fruity wine ready for immediate enjoyment.

title: Elio Filippino 2013 Serra Capelli  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of cedar, menthol and dark berry emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers ripe black plum, mocha and clove alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Elizabeth Chambers 2015 Lazy River Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Still tasting quite young, this tight, chewy wine seems to be in the midst of pulling itself together. Components of sour plum, wild cherry and green tea are in place, but the seamless ripeness of past vintages is not, at least for now.

title: Elizabeth Chambers 2015 Russell-Grooters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Compact and stubbornly closed, this offers suggestions of plum and cherry, framed with stem and earth. The tannins conjure up black tea, finishing dark and astringent.

title: Fabio Zambolin 2015 Vallelonga Nebbiolo (Coste della Sesia)
description: Tense and linear, this offers pomegranate, clove, menthol and licorice flavors. Taut close-grained tannins provide the tight framework while fresh acidity lends balance. Drink after 2020.

title: Fairsing 2016 Sullivan Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Other than slight clonal variations in the three estate blends, there's little to differentiate the 2016 Pinots from Fairsing, at least at this young age. This has the same citrus component and wild blackberry fruit as the wine labeled Estate. Barrel aging for 10 months in 30% new French oak adds a touch of vanilla wafer.

title: Francis Blanchet 2017 Silice  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This tense, dense wine is still young. Its pure line in acidity is emphasized by the concentration and strong minerality. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2017 Schiefer Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)
description: Notes of wet slate, green apple and orange blossom perfume this delicately off-dry wine. The palate is juicy, offering a pristine citrus flavor that is accented by zesty acidity and a clean, mineral finish. While not a deeply concentrated wine, it is invigorating and thirst quenching.

title: Gyéjacquot Frères NV Anatom Blanc Vrai Brut  (Champagne)
description: This blend holds Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, the latter aged briefly in wood. The result is a generous wine, the acidity integrated into ripe apple flavors. It is fruity, still a young bottling and likely to benefit from a few more months of aging. Drink from 2019.

title: Huett 2017 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)
description: This half-stainless- and half-neutral-oak-fermented wine takes a gentle approach to this variety. The natural acidity and herbaceousness of Sauvignon Blanc is softened here with 10 g/L of residual sugar. The wine is round and fruity, with a mix of preserved lemon, white peach and pineapple. Drink slightly chilled.

title: Jean Laurent NV Cuvée Blanche Brut Pinot Blanc (Champagne)
description: It's often forgotten that Pinot Blanc is one of the permitted grapes in Champagne. Normally found in the Aube, it makes, as here, a wine softer than Chardonnay, with ripe white fruits and an open texture. This wine is attractive, fruity and ready to drink.
